Thanks to #ImACeleb I’ve seen more of BBC News than I would normally choose to. Its demotion of Brexit as a story - esp in this of all weeks - is, compared to ITV, Sky and Channel 4, blatant. It covers it - but you always know it really rather wouldn’t.

Just got round to reading Neal Ascherson’s piece in The Observer on Armistice Day in 1918 and what followed. Beautiful, informative, on point, and, as always, relevant. If Scotland ever does a journalistic hall of fame he has to be a shoo-in.

Every now and then I see a tweet that reminds me of surely the most inexplicable of all human behaviours. Some people still watch Reporting Scotland. I know this sounds like drollery but it isn’t. I genuinely cannot understand it.
